Cesar,

Could you tell me a little more about your NEAT Python project?  I
=
have heard a bit about it but I don't know what it's being used for or
whet=
her it is intended to be a general-purpose tool for the public? 
If so, wou=
ld you like me to link it from the NEAT Users page and my
homepage?

ken

-=

>
> =
Derek,
>

=

iliar with them, but she's been working with these models in her
> research=
.

> http://code.go=
ogle.com/p/neat-python/source/browse -- what you want is
> in /trunk/neat/i=
fnn. The code is a mix of Python and C++, but there is
> a "pure python" ve=
rsion of the InF and some C++ bindings. You can
> easily understand the sou=
rces since Python is "almost" like
> pseudo-code :-)
